p: Data from MERS-CoV, which broke out in 2012 in Saudi Arabia, showed that the severity and length of the pulmonary pathology observed were increased in those affected by type 2 diabetes, which likely deregulates immune response ( 6). Data on COVID-19 in patients with diabetes is limited at present ( 5). The Chinese Centre for Disease Control and Prevention published a report of 72,314 cases of COVID-19, showing an increased mortality rate in subjects with diabetes ( 7).
